## Other tutorials, blogs, and articles

[Leveraging Generative AI: Applications for the LTER
Network](https://lternet.edu/stories/leveraging-generative-ai-applications-for-the-lter-network/)

[AI for NCEAS](https://nceas-learning-hub.github.io/ai_for_nceas/)

[AI for research: the ultimate guide to choosing the right
tool](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-01069-0)

[Github copilot for beginners
blog](https://github.blog/ai-and-ml/github-copilot/github-for-beginners-how-to-get-started-with-github-copilot/)

Chris Brown's
[Blog](https://www.seascapemodels.org/bluecology_blog.html) has a lot of
useful tips for ecologists getting started with AI. His
[Article](https://doi.org/10.32942/X2CS80) and
[Tutorial](https://www.seascapemodels.org/rstats/2025/06/27/prompting-llms-quality-ecological-statistics.html)
on using LLMs for ecological statistics are good reading if you want to
delve into this realm (but see [Danger Zone](AI_3_Danger_zone.qmd)).

[Copilot in VS code cheat
sheet](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/reference/copilot-vscode-features)

you work on other things.
